page.title: 07 The Ferry Centre Oxford
page.content: Many tourists come to the Ferry leisure centre. People can swim and play squash,take lessons for swimming or go for fun. North Oxford raised money to build it,then pursuaded the council to give them planning permission.It was completed in 1976,the squash courts were completed in 1982. It is open everyday, but Sunday is the busiest day. The pool is used much more than the squash courts.It is 75p for an adult to enter the pool, and 45p for a child. There is a snack bar from where you can view the swimmers. There is also an extension on the building where community meetings are held and jumble-sales as well. The future is currently being considered:should it be expanded to include more facilities?
